Key Match Events: Paolo Banchero missed a game-tying 3-point attempt at the buzzer that could have sent the game into overtime
Giannis Antetokounmpo led the Bucks with a game-high 41 points to go along with 14 rebounds
Pre-Game Insights: Magic coach Jamahl Mosley spoke about the return of Paolo Banchero to the roster and what their expectations were
Coach Mosley said that finding the flow again takes time and that it's going to be a transition period
Post-Match Reflections: The Orlando Magic welcomed Paolo Banchero's return, but are aware that some transition is needed as they reintegrate the All-Star forward in their attack
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paolo Banchero's stats tonight against the Milwaukee Bucks: 34 points, 7 rebounds, 3 assists, 3 steals, and a block in 27 minutes
The Orlando Magic are currently fifth in the Eastern Conference with a 22-18 record
Others: The Magic expect some transition time in Paolo Banchero's return
Paolo Banchero made his long-awaited return to action after missing 34 games because of injury on Friday
